title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process has been a pleasure. The university were very responsive and the process was handled in a very professional manner. In both times that I've interviewed with the university, one getting the job and the other not getting the job, I was pleased with the way both situations were handled.
Interview Questions: Explain to us a time that you disagreed with a supervisor. How did you handle that situation?

title: Seasonal Retail Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Hiring through EFollett. They have a phone interview to ensure that you can start the days that they need you to. They don’t ask any questions about your self or your past experience and if you can start work on the day that they need, they hire you on the spot.
Interview Questions: What day I could start.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Was ok. Communication right up until the visit and after was very limited. Meeting itself was quite thorough. I wished that there had been more discussion before and after the in-person meeting.
Interview Questions: How would you shape the program differently?

title: Testing Lab Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very easy, we just went over availability and resume. Interviewer then asked what I knew about ADA and the job position. It only lasted around ten to twenty minutes.
Interview Questions: What do you know about ADA?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions:
Nice place for research， world top class
facilities, phone interview going throng my resume, asked one technical question about phase diagram, it was pretty easy, discussed about my next project
Interview Questions: what is the phase diagram of water? Draw and explain

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Contacted via email weeks after applying. Interview was performed via zoom on at a specific time. Two supervisors were present and asked the typical questions you would expect from an interview
Interview Questions: What makes you good for this position?

title: Sports Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: First, there was a phone call interview in which the candidate is asked 3 questions. These questions are designed to know the candidate. Secondly, there was a zoom interview in which more detailed questions about your interest in the position are asked. Make sure to ask questions to show interest as
Interview Questions: Why do you want to apply for this position?

title: Campus Recreation Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Florida State University in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was made up of a group portion and an individual portion. The interviewers were very kind and interested in what I had to say. They asked thought provoking questions and made sure I felt comfortable.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Employee Relations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: The scheduling of the interview was well organized. The organization was very accommodating by conducting the interview via Zoom. The interviewer was prompt, professional, yet  friendly. The interview lasted approximately 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you're the right candidate for this position.

title: Night Staff Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Simple questions regarding past work experiences. Nothing to crazy but they do ask about your sleep schedule(necessary for the job). Turn in your resume and prepare for one interview that last roughly 30 - 40 minutes.
Interview Questions: How is your sleep schedule?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Made you show proficiency in the subject as well as ability to teach someone else. Did not expect you to know everything being tested but did want to see how you worked with information you did not know to see how you would help a student in that situation
Interview Questions: Please use this textbook to create a plan to solve an example problem

title: Data Project Manager Nd Quality Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: There were two rounds of interviews after submitting the application FSU jobs site.  First-round questions were good but more general and chosen from a pre-canned list. The second round questions were more nuts and bolts.
Interview Questions: Describe your opinion on working within a team.

title: Business Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions:
A short in-person interview with a list of questions:
Tell me about yourself
Do you have experience in an office
What is your availability
Strengths and weaknesses

They described what the department does and what my role would be.
Interview Questions:
Do you have experience in an office?
What is your availability?
Strengths and weaknesses?

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Basic assessment of Oracle DB, and Peoplesoft. Knowledge of working in education industry is a plus. The company is slowly moving towards cloud, so any kind of cloud experience goes a long way.
Interview Questions: Describe how you would tune a sql query?

title: Research Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Really smooth interview process.  They asked great questions and really made me feel at ease during the whole thing. A little slow in the start-up, but that's understandable. Still waiting to hear back for an offer after a few weeks of back and forth, but with the current changing climate, I totally get it.
Interview Questions: Please tell us about yourself.

title: Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Email was sent to confirm date. The interview was in person (before COVID-19). People present included the role's supervisor and a few of prospective colleagues. General questions regarding role and career goals.
Interview Questions: How will this job help you with future career goals?

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: It was very smooth and thorough. The interviewer was very considerate and asked about my past experiences which I explained. She also asked me about my design process and asked me to tell her about myself.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my past projects, what my style is, what my approach is to new designs, and how I handle difficult situations.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Just went in and talked to the employer who was hiring me. They asked about my prior experiences in the working field and then about how often I can work
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Robotics Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions: The lab director just went through my resume asking me questions all every thing. Then we went over a code I wrote and walking though every line and what it means.
Interview Questions:
Do you have any personal projects?
What engineering topics are you interested in?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick moving. They needed to fill the position quickly before the beginning of the fall semester. I submitted a resume upon recommendation from a friend and was interviewed later that week. I interviewed with the academic director and the dean of the college.
Interview Questions: How do you like puzzles? Because going through transcripts is like a puzzle.

title: Occupational Health Receptionist/Administration Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed yet welcoming. Great staff and environment that make the interview process calming and inviting.  Speaking to such educated professionals inspires you to continue on in the field and makes working in the healthcare field so much better.
Interview Questions: How I handle difficult patients

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was smooth. HR personnel reached out to me to set up. The interviewers were friendly and personable. It was conducted over the phone and the questions were mostly related to the position.
Interview Questions: If you could have any super power, what would you be and why?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions:
Resume shortlist and interview. lot of question in between the seminar. I answered almost almost of them. Prepare for more fundamental questions. 
I missed the offer because of the relevance with the work.
Interview Questions: presentation for 40min and questions followed by

title: Driver Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: The process went great and quick. The people interviewed me made me feel comfortable so therefore I was very confident while taking my interview. Definitely will recommend this company to somebody else.
Interview Questions: Why would I like to work at Fsu

title: Student Athlete Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: I applied by emailing my resume and unofficial transcript to the manager. Then I emailed to schedule an interview. At the interview, I was offered the position. I was told the pay and guidelines of the office at the interview.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my prior tutoring experience and my personal study patterns. I was asked how I would react in certain situations with a student (like if they have no school motivation or just don't know how to study)

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Applied to the intern program, received a call a few weeks later from the person in charge asking a few questions about my familiarity with the project they were working on and giving me the internship on the spot.
Interview Questions: tell me about your classes?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: the interview was straight forward and was simple. normally you give a talk to a broad audience and follow by that are some discussion with the committee there. Then after that tour around the lab and discuss about projects.
Interview Questions: What's your goal in five years?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida State University in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was light, quick, and easy. Everyone was really friendly and wanted to know your honest answers. They really valued charisma and willingness to learn, so even if you don't exactly know what entails, I would still apply
Interview Questions: Q: Tell me something about yourself.

title: Financial Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Smoothly! I did not have a problem. There was an interview panel of 3 people and each took a turn asking me questions. Overall a smooth process and not as nerve wrecking as I thought it would be.
Interview Questions: What is your experience using Excel?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: You have a group interview and then a 1:1 interview. In the group interview, you are tasked with using songs to describe your identities, then you and your group complete an escape room.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an RA?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with the Residence Life department for a receptionist role. Shortly after, I received a call from the Contracts and Assignments department. There, I interviewed with an Assistant Director for an Office Assistant position instead of the Receptionist position I originally applied for.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for the university?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was made to be very easygoing and fun in order to show your true skills as a leader and individual.  Part of the interview required you to work with others as a team and complete tasks while the other portion consisted of an individual interview.
Interview Questions: How do you manage working with difficult people and what actions do you take?

title: Front End Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: IT was short and sweet, they explained how they work and asked me If I have worked on similar projects and since I was a new graduate they asked me to get at least 2 refferences.
Interview Questions: Did you work on similar projects?

title: Grants Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was welcoming and engaging, using smart questions to guide the conversation.  As we talked about why work at FSU, one of the panel responded it’s good to be a part of something larger than yourself that you can see and hear (office is close to Mag Lab) and this place is full of color as opposed to other places where the same type of administrative work is done.
Interview Questions: Tell us about the shift in your career 10 years ago?

title: Web Applications Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online
Received telephonic/webex interview invitation after 2 weeks.
Great team explained their working style and business.
Interviewed about my application development experience, coding , examples of my work in my words, problem solving , new tech upgrades and team/individual style preferences.
I still did not hear anything from them, hoping it would be a yes because we got on same boat many times.
Interview Questions: what is the newest thing you have updated in your project

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed with Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) professor in 2018. They delayed the process for a long time. Whenever I emailed them, they said just waiting but they did not extend a final offer.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous experiences. Why you were interested in this position?

title: Social Media Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very simple, asked me a few questions and told me about what the day to day responsibilities would be. Very quick as well, not any difficult questions— definitely don’t be worried!
Interview Questions: What is your major and GPA?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Brief phone interview with prospective adviser. Flown in to interview with department faculty. Easy interview and the faculty sold me on the university. Stayed in hotel payed for by the department. Went to dinner with adviser and other graduate students to talk about research and grad school experience.
Interview Questions: What type of research work have you done as an undergraduate?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Met with department heads and toured the facilities. Had lunch with other graduate students. Met individual professors I may work with. Toured the city to learn about living there and toured the university
Interview Questions: My choices of possible research topics and interest in research

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Miami, FL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very easy questions to answer have drivers license and social set card on hard they will ask for two forms of ID, ask about yourself and your qualifications for the job and why you want to work there
Interview Questions: How can I make the position I’m applying for better

title: Interviewer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Not very long, bases on if you had previous Personal Training Experience and if you are a good person. They also asked you to speak to two or three managers depending on what position you want to have there
Interview Questions: How many tennis balls fit in this facility

title: Telecounselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Really simple, laid back process. Casual interview, was not hard at all. Applied online, came in for one interview, go the call the next day saying that I got the job.
Interview Questions: What are your greatest weaknesses?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was easy and very relaxed. Asked basic questions and wanted to know how you were doing in school. Asked for a few professor references and a copy of your transcript.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: The on-site interview was very smooth, and the committee ensured that I had a positive experience. The schedule was tight as in any other interviews, but it was very comprehensive and I was out of the whole experience feeling very gratified. I was not offered a job, but it was a positive experience.
Interview Questions: If you were to describe your strength, what word(s) would you use?

title: Accounting Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Quick and easy in my opinion! I was interviewing for two positions at one time but knew the interview panel from my previous work experience. I heard back within a week of my interview that they wanted to proceed with the background check and salary analysis.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths and weaknesses

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very simple. I simply emailed back and forth with the hiring manager. She asked very few questions and I answered promptly. I was supposed to have an in person interview but I was not in town thus email was sufficient.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here and what is your schedule like?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Two person interview. Test of Spanish fluency, since the job required significant travel and recruiting of students in south Florida. Easy to talk to, comfortable setting with mission-focused conversation. Required in depth knowledge of student opportunities, activities, and financial aid info.
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you with a significant amount of travel?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: There are a series of interviews both group and individual. The group interviews are just as important as the individuals, so don't ignore them. In the group interviews don't be that person who talks over everyone else in the group.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an RA?

title: Laboratory Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Orlando, FL) in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions: It takes a long time, but it's not that bad. The management has a high turn over rate, so they try their best to get students or people who belong in fast food.
Interview Questions: They want a story about your compassion.  Usually people make one up.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida State University in Jun 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Wouldn’t it be great if you knew exactly what questions a hiring manager would be asking you in your next job interview?

We can’t read minds, unfortunately, but we’ll give you the next best thing: a list of more than 40 of the most commonly asked interview questions, along with advice for answering them all.

While we don’t recommend having a canned response for every interview question (in fact, please don’t), we do recommend spending some time getting comfortable with what you might be asked, what hiring managers are really looking for in your responses, and what it takes to show that you’re the right person for the job.

Consider this list your interview question and answer study guide.
Interview Questions:
What is virtual memory? 
What is Spark?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Where do I start?  Fast track to get grant up and going. Before I get the job offer they started sending me work to do. Red flag!  I still took that job and it was the worst experience I’ve ever had.
Interview Questions: Are you used to multitasking?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: I was not invited to interview weekend but instead had a phone interview. The phone interview took about 45 minutes and just talked about research experiences generally. Overall it was a pleasant experience.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to go to gradaute school here?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Easy and relaxed. The interviewer was very sweet and understood that I was just starting out in my career. It was in her office and her interns were present. I had known her because of a friend so it was not the first time meeting her
Interview Questions: Do you know how to code?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: Apply online. If your resume and cover letter and above average, you get offered an interview. Quick, 20 minute interview trying to get to know your personality and skills. Then they reach out with an answer a week or so later.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you failed and what did you do to overcome it.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: had interview with housing manager. Very nice and easy process. Very casual, spoke about involvement on campus and what I would bring to the hall. After initial interview I herd back very quickly
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you had to deal with a difficult customer

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: There was a multistep group interview with partner and group activities across three separate modules. Then there was a second interview in a panel-style interview/resume review. Not all nine panelists asked a question, but all of them took notes.
Interview Questions: What has been your most challenging work situation? How did you handle that?

title: Administrative Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I was called for an in-person interview a few weeks after applying. It was a 3 person panel interview with the supervisor, the assistant director and the associate director of the department. A few behavioral based questions and a few technical/skill based questions.

Very chill interview, much like a conversation.
Interview Questions: Do you have any accounting experience?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Submit an online application first, then attend a two day interview process. You are split into small groups and you do several activities in those. Then you are called in for a singular interview.
Interview Questions: What kind of floor programs you would come up with?

title: Trip Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Several months as a trainee. No pay but required lots of work. Was a secondary leader and did most of the functions trip leaders do during the training period. The trips are free though
Interview Questions: Not really a formal interview just a training period with no pay but hey the trips are free

title: Administrative & Professional Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Phone call within a week from external recruiter to schedule a phone interview. Typical questions about my experience, what's my current salary, what are my salary expectations, etc. Next was phone interview with hiring manager. Next was in-person interview shortly after on campus with a panel of people I'd be working with. Most questions seemed like they were reading off a list from HR, although some were specific to the position and my experience with related tasks. About a week later an offer was made, negotiated slightly higher salary, and accepted, although had some challenges with HR throughout the offer process.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself, how would you handle (this situation), what are you looking for in employment here, why should we hire you, etc.

title: Program Director of Investigations and Incidents Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was interview by 3 people that were in higher management position and they asked question about my goals and issues I faced in the past with my employers and employees.  The question were not hard.  You need to know what your 5 year plan is because they will ask you that question.
Interview Questions: What are my 5 year goals or plan.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: Found out about the opportunity through a friend and was called in pretty quickly in for an interview. Straightforward one interview with their director of communications within the center. Requested to see my portfolio not in advance but during the interview which was a little strange.
Interview Questions: How would you manage competing projects?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was swift and fairly easy. A minimal amount of questions . Employees are extremely nice and offer help in anythings. Responsibilities include answering phones, accommodating staff/ faculty and students.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Customer Service Rep for campus recreation - turn in resume and cover letter then one interview before job offer. Not a bad interview at all. Very comfortable and super nice interviewers. Pretty basic questions - just be friendly and easy to talk to.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Athletic Department Marketing and Promotions Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Mostly online. You submit an application and then they ask for a project proposal. Once you do that, you'll get an email about the job within the next 2 weeks
Interview Questions: To make a mock event

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Typical questions. Was asked about how i would be beneficial and what i could bring to the DIS. Very casual, went straight from class to interview. Professor was calming and understood having nerves.
Interview Questions: What is your gpa and current class load?

title: Bilingual Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process began a month after I submitted my application. Since I was out of town management scheduled a phone interview with me. Within the week I was offered the position and set to work within the next two weeks.
Interview Questions: Why would you be a good fit for FCRR?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
- Phone call with several advisors 
- Basic questions 
- Applied online and followed up with an email 
- Sent in resume 
- Did one phone call interview 
- Easy and not stressful
Interview Questions:
- What are your goals in life
- Why do you want this job 
- Are you good under stress

title: Ops Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was offered the job after meeting the Deans. I was offered the job before I even knew it was open, and found out from a mentor. It is great if you know someone at the University, as FSU employees are very close and pretty much everyone knows each other.
Interview Questions: If you are enthusiastic, team player.

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: it was a one-on-one between me and the manager of the university.  it was held in his office, and it last less than 30 minutes. at the end, he have to ask question
Interview Questions: experience, skill, availability

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Formal interview process. They make you feel comfortable during the process. Do not show up very casual to the interview just because it is a receptionist review. The directors of the dorm still take the position very seriously. You will be the "face" of the dorm for all residents and guest who enter.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a complaining parent?

title: Intramural Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Submit application then you will have a group interview with a panel of supervisors and head staff. Then they take a few days to deliberate and then send you an email with your hiring letter.
Interview Questions: Lots of random questions. they vary drastically

title: IT Support Technician (OPS) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, submitting my résumé with a cover letter and references.  About 1 1/2 weeks later, I received a phone call directly from the position's supervisor to schedule an interview.  I interviewed for the position at the supervisor's office.  The questions were rather basic about IT and support.  Mainly what "would you do" scenarios and "Have you ever worked with X, Y, or Z?"  Within a week, I got a call back telling me I had gotten the position.  A Level 2 background check, including fingerprinting, was required for the position as well.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a frustrated and upset customer after already providing several solutions?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The FSU RA Interview Process is broken into two parts. The first part revolves around teamwork with you doing three activities with a team of 10-15 other people. Second part is a 20-30 minute interview at the end of the Interview Process where you will be interviewed by a current HS and current RA.
Interview Questions: Imagine you are on-duty and while on rounds you notice a student has tearing down your hall decorations, how would you confront this situation?

title: Graduation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Before I applied for the job online through the FSU website, I personally spoke to the supervisor of the department in-person about whether there were any available part-time positions for a student.
Interview Questions: How do you manage time for both being a full-time student and a part-time employee?

title: Program Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: The process takes longer than you think so be patient. You get called in. Most jobs require two interviews.The process takes longer than you think so be patient. You get called in. Most jobs require two interviewsThe process takes longer than you think so be patient. You get called in. Most jobs require two interviews
Interview Questions: What do you know about Florida State? What do you know about this department?

title: Human Resources Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: You may have a one-on-one interview with the manager of the team or you may interview several members of the team - in more of a panel format.  In the next stage you'll interview with the head of the department.  You may also be asked to take a skills assessment test - basic math, HR concepts, etc.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about a time you were faced with an ethical dilemma and how you dealt with it. 
Tell me about a time where you had to work as a member of a team, what was your role.

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Asked a few questions, and the next week they offered me the position. It was an easy interview, since I already had my feet in the door. The overall experience wasn't bad at all. It was easy, but once you got in the turning around was different they treated you differently
Interview Questions: MY work skill

title: Attorney Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Three rounds of interviews.Search committee has standard questions.  First round of interviews related to the type of work I was going to be doing. Second round of interviews the person did not have an idea what the job entailed.  Third round of interview dealt with impromptu questions.
Interview Questions: Asked what I knew about the specific office I would working at.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: there is no formal interview. Only got two superviser asked us basic questions about chemistry and if we had any teaching experiences. it was very easy and casual. I did not feel any pressure when they are doing this interview
Interview Questions: did you have any work experience before

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL)
Interview Descriptions: Requires an above-average GPA. Job selection mostly at the discretion of a graduate-committee. Previous relevant academic experience, TOEFL/SPEAK score, ability to manage a class of 15-25 students are the main deciding factors.
Interview Questions: Vary depending on the lab being instructed.

title: Customer Service Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Fort Lauderdale, FL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: short and quick. the questions very direct and to the point. the interview was one of the easiest i've attended. they knew what they were looking for and if you fit that description. it was about three or four questions. my answers were precise and to the point. i dont have anything else to say but i have to fill this box. its  a great instuition to work for and everyone is super frienly,
Interview Questions: tell us about yourself?

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (Saint Petersburg, FL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Not a real interview. It was a quick replacement fill. Previous employee gave 2 week notice before school started. They needed someone to replace the spot as soon as possible. I was referred.
Interview Questions: What is your previous teaching experience

title: Ops Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview was minimal, I was basically handed the job. It was the easiest interview I've ever had. They didn't really ask me anything, just when I could start and if I was OK with the hours.
Interview Questions: They just asked me when I could start and how comfortable I was with handling difficult situations like conflicts with students using study rooms.

title: Operations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Panel of 4 supervisors each asking 3-4 questions regarding experience, confidentiality matters, and some scenarios to see how you would react. It was a little bit awkward at first because they just go in a circle asking questions and writing down your response. You also sit at the head of the conference table and they sit surrounding you.
Interview Questions: How comfortable would you feel doing saying yes or no to someone based on what your employer wants even if it went against your personal beliefs?

title: Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL)
Interview Descriptions: My friend was working there and refereed me for an interview. I interviewed in person with two people and then was asked about my availability. It was relaxed, and informal. Basically, it was screening to see if I was well spoken and willing to work hard. There weren’t any crazy questions.
Interview Questions: When can you work?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Meet with search committee, office staff, and the director. The half-day interview could have been slated for the morning or afternoon. I received my interview agenda a few days prior to the interview
Interview Questions:
Why are you interested in FSU and this role?
What are some anticipated challenges do you expect to experience?
How do you plan to bring innovation and change to the role.

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Talked with the head HR hiring manager, he was very nice, asked me all the questions, and personally discussed the hiring process to me. After being officially chosen I met with my location manager and discussed the specifics with him.
Interview Questions: Honestly none of the questions were difficult, very straightforward and had to apply past experiences to future scenarios.

title: Bookstore Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Florida State University in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: The manager and I shook hands and then sat down. Then, she began describing the positions that were available and asked me what position I would be interested in working. As soon as I said cashier or any of the positions that I must interact with customers, she shook my hand and said "Welcome". Extremely nice manager and pleasant interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Programmer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: I sent an email to the Data Center director implying my interest in the open position. He got back to me within a few days and we scheduled an interview. The interview consisted of my past experiences in computer science and some behavioral questions. The interview did not take long and they got back to me within a few days offering me the position. There was no technical interview.
Interview Questions: What computer science courses have you taken?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: In person interview with the supervisor. Asked some of general questions and provided some descriptions of the position. not a difficult process and the supervisor was easy to speak with.
Interview Questions: Would you mind doing a lot of scanning?

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The person who interviewed candidates was the direct boss for the interviewer.  You begin by finding the position listed on the FSU job board (at the time it was through omni I believe).  From there you're selected for an interview.  You typically should interview as soon as you can for this position so the sooner you can make yourself available the better.  Prior professional experience can help but it isn't necessary.  Instead you should have SOME code to provide for her before or after the interview.  You can bring it to the interview too but really it won't matter, just as long as it is YOUR code.  My suggestion is to write a cover letter and think about what the boss wants to know.  Basically why "this" position is what the boss wants to know.  If you live in another town and you're applying you should say explain why (maybe you're going to attend school in Tallahassee or something)

Also you'll need to be able to pass a background check that permits you to work around children because you may be required to work around children at some point during special events.

Pay is not negotiable, whatever is listed on the job posting is what you'll get.
Interview Questions: Interview questions were standard behavioral questions.  The biggest question I think the interviewer will care about is to describe some coding that you've done.  "What was a hard problem you had to solve and how" or something like that.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: All the computer science graduates got an email regarding this job position from the graduate school department . Eligible applicants were called for a face to face interview. The interview lasted for an hour and if they find you fit for the role they will offer you the position. This position comes with a tuition waiver and a monthly stipend.
Interview Questions: They just asked about your projects and interest .

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very short and it only took talking to the professor. After talking to the professor I waited for my paperwork to get approved by the University. I had to make sure that all of that was getting done by myself, instead of HR. I was given the job after the interview so it was a stressful process. The school is good at being direct. They tend to hire good students who would benefit from the experience.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: No interview. Based on your GPA and courses. If you have taken up programming courses, you should be good. All courses with projects will help you. Taking only theory courses won't get you the job.
Interview Questions: No interview. Based on your GPA and courses.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The position was hired off GMAT scores and overall resume strength. Typically, the department director reaches out to you and speaks to you regarding the position, responsibilities, and role that teaching assistants play in the university. He/she has typically made up their mind prior to speaking to you. So long as you seem excited and grateful for the opportunity, you will receive the assistantship.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Technical Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met the System Analyst at the College Career Fair during the Spring 2014 semester.  I gave my resume to one of the employees on the team.  I received a call right before the Summer Term 2014 about a couple of vacancies that were going to be available for Summer and was asked if I would like to come in and interview for one of the positions.  Three days later I came in and did a 1:1 interview with the System Analyst and it was pretty much Resume Driven.  Then I was called back about five days later and was offered a position on the team during the start of the Summer Term 2014.
Interview Questions: Now that I have your Resume.  Tell me about yourself using your Resume as a model.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied and was contacted within days for an interview. I had to play phone tag with the hall coordinator hiring me to set up a phone interview, but other than that the process was very simple and easy.
Interview Questions: Easy interview questions; what are your strengths, weaknesses, etc.

title: IT Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Phone call and then interview within 2 weeks
Interview Questions: What are five important things in project management

title: Computer Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a group panel interview that consisted of an Asst. Dir., a programmer, and the former head of IT. We had it over lunch and had a discussion. We are under FSU but are a sub department that hires its own IT personnel
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Its a work study position so it was just over email.
Interview Questions: There was no unexpected questions.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Submitted my application. Selected candidates will be invited for an on-site interview to meet graduate students and faculty members in a poster session. Candidates can meet the professors you are interested in working with.
Interview Questions: My prior research project

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: You have to write a letter stating why you want the job. You need letter explaining why are you a good fit for the position. You need approval from your proffessors as well as their recommendations
Interview Questions: How would you make our system more effective

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Florida State University in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Apply through University Housing. Consists of a weekend long events ranging from interviews with Current Resident Assistants and Housing Directors to team-building activities to interact with others. You are assigned to a group with a leader and brought around to the events all weekend. You aren't competing with the people in your group. FSU Housing is about team-work and building relationships, so it's important that you can get along with others before you think about taking this job. If you don't like interacting on a day to day basis with people and aren't upbeat, you will hate the job. Negative people serve no purpose in our happy RA world. Every interview process should be this relaxed and fun!
Interview Questions: Normal interview questions. It's important to remember to be yourself! The housing staff at FSU is so diverse and there is not a cookie-cutter type of RA.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: After application review, an onsite interview is conducted and based on qualifications, hiring follows if the applicant answers all the questions well and has a good GPA in their academics, mainly in Math and Science. A supervisor then arranges for question paper and gives time for solving the questions which should be done in white paper provided by them.
Interview Questions: Basic math and english questions. Includes calculus, algebra, geometry.

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: they asked questions and i answered them based on my experience. it was a whole committee of 7 people interviewing me then I got sent to the higher tier of two .
Interview Questions: it has been a long time so i don't remember. they ask why I'm qualified . They asked what my weaknesses were and that was a tough one.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: After I submitted my C.V. I got a response in like an hour. Then my mentor called my PhD advisor to ask about me. Then we scheduled a Skype interview that lasted for like 10 to 15 minutes. I got an offer on the same day. The whole process took few days.
Interview Questions: This was easy. My mentor just wanted to know me and he check out my skills.

title: ERP Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: The jobs are posted on jobs.fsu.edu. The qualified candidates are interviewed. Usually couple of interviews. The interview is conducted by IT manager and senior analysts.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Video Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and professional but the manager who interviewed me no longer works their so this review would not be very helpful to you. Sorry but staff gets rotated so fast here that by the time you get an interview there is no telling who will interview you and what they would want to see.
Interview Questions: What is frame rate

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I got interviewed by Dr. Shuyuan Mary Ho and the interview was in an informal setting. I had a friend who was interviewed along with me. I was referred to this position by the person who worked there before.
Interview Questions: What is my background and what are my projects and the technologies that I know?

title: Scientific Research Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with the Director and Assistant Director. The questions were straightforward and job-related, as well as exploratory ("what is your customer service philosophy?"). The trick for these straightforward interviews is, as best I can tell, to not over-answer the question.
Interview Questions: What is your customer service philosophy?

title: Custodial Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jul 2013
Interview Descriptions: There is a two part interview process. When I interviewed initially it was the hr subset of the department. There was about a two week period before I received a callback. I then interviewed with a department head and a senior supervisor.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a co-worker that is not performing their daily tasks properly by failing to clean certain offices or classrooms?

title: Personal Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: A physical application is turned in to the fitness desk, If you are selected for an interview you interview at the gym in front of 3-5 supervisors. The interview process takes about 30 minutes, where you are asked a series of questions from each supervisor. After completing the interview if you are hired you will receive an email within the week.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weaknesses?

title: Conference Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Easiest interview I've been to. He asked 5ish questions over ~20 minutes, then I was hired immediately afterward. Super basic stuff like "what do you think customer service is?" and "explain a difficult experience you've had with a customer in the past." This is basically just a free summer job for students that aren't complete idiots.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Introduce yourself and talk about your opinion on the research topics in the group. The interview is conducted via phone. It is not that official but more casual. After the interview, the offer came within a week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join this group?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: i did not have an interview. i just sent out my application folder for a phd program and they evaluated it and offered me a graduate research assistantship with tuition waiver.
Interview Questions: i did not have an interview. i just sent out my application folder for a phd program and they evaluated it and offered me a graduate research assistantship with tuition waiver.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process. Only talk with the professor.
Interview Questions: There is no significant difficult question.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: Was immediately accepted after I became an author on a manuscript from my undergradute research
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Two-day process with many 1-1 discussions with faculty, followed by an seminar presentation.  A hotel room for two nights was provided and all meals were taken care off.
Interview Questions: What is your reason for applying here.

title: Oglesby Union Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Florida State University
Interview Descriptions: A very informal interviewing process; there was only one interview given and after that I waited for a call back.
Interview Questions: What is your ultimate career goal?

title: University Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: paper application for initial screening then if selected to move on will participate in a group interview then if selected again to move on will receive part of the tour to memorize and present for a debut tour
Interview Questions: Favorite memory at FSU? How do you solve conflict?

title: Interventionst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Florida State University in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: You are interviewed by site coordinator.  The interview process was pretty easy.  Not many hard questions and if you seem interested in the job and are professional, they will hire you.
Interview Questions: What is the best thing you like about teaching?

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions:
They have pool for HR positions for each semester. Recruiters retrieve candidates to be interviewed from the pool. 

General behavioral questions. Got a phone call and attended the interview.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: You apply online through the housing website for Florida State University and you will get a phone call from a hall supervisor for an interview if they are interested in hiring you. The interview consists of the hall supervisor and a current receptionist asking questions and they record your responses.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Good interview process. Well structured process, and I received detailed agenda in advance. Polite individuals but some tough questions. Good comments during the presentation, which helped improve research. Best of all, they offered me a job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to move to FSU?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: There are a lot of people who apply. You are in a group setting (about 8-10 people) and go through a series of activities where you are observed on your leadership skills. You interview with a Hall Director and a Resident Assistant. Your "host" is observing you all weekend long as well as other RA's in the rooms you are doing activities in.
Interview Questions: If you had unlimited amount of money to spend on a program, what would you do and why?

title: University Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Nov 2011
Interview Descriptions: Group interview and if selected, you had to do 3 months of training to learn the script and give tours. Long process, but you really have to spend time to learn everything.
Interview Questions: What animal would you be and why?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions:
This was a library assistant position that you have to be student to get it. It was mainly a position to help students find books and services at the library.
Met with the supervisor and answered few questions about the student assistant role. It wasn't difficult since it was an OPS type position.
Interview Questions: Work history.

title: Business Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: Disorganized
Interview Questions: Your employment record indicates that you change jobs frequently

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Online application, mostly interested in research interests and future work. Required information such as GRE scores (math is the most important component) and undergraduate transcripts. There is a big emphasis on the math course one has had, as well as the grades one achieved in these courses. It is probably more important than the economics courses.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (East China, MI) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I applied for 12 Ph.D. programs and this was the only offer I got. I was called by a professor, who is now my Ph.D. adviser and we were talking over the phone for about 1 hour. I was told that I got the position at the end of the phone call.
Interview Questions: Do you have hands-on experience in the lab?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Completed GRE and submitted application with GRE scores to Florida State University.  Got acceptance notification quite rapidly after submission.
Interview Questions: On the graduate admissions essay, applicants were encouraged to explain what they intended to after graduation.  Not the easiest question to answer.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Not a former interview, just a phone call ask some personal info. It took roughly 30 minutes to finish. Not very complicate, don't worry too much about it. Just a simple chatting.
Interview Questions: What is your current degree?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Florida State University in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions:
It started back in the fall of my freshman semester when the initial application window was available. I had close ties with my RA at the time so getting a recommendation was not a huge problem (Getting a recommendation from someone in Housing is a huge plus, if not either your current employer or professor would help as well). 

The actual interview didn't happen until early spring, when it was spread out over one weekend. The Friday night before consisted of a group orientation, going over who will have which schedule (some people do it all on a Saturday whereas some people carry over on Sunday). During your interview day (or Selection day), you and your group will experience a number of "real-world" scenarios where you'll be tested on how much RA potential you have. As is usual for interview etiquette don't be rockin' it out like a rock-star and don't pretend you're in a confession booth. After you go through your scenarios, you'll finally do your actual interview - one with a coordinator/assistant coordinator and one with a RA. They do it all in one room so make sure you raise your voice.
Interview Questions: What have you done recently that benefited the community overall?

title: Student Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I learned about the Phone Center at a job fair at FSU. I was told by a representative that they are responsible for acquiring donations to the University by making phone calls. I was also told they pay up to $10 per hour, so I went home and applied online (the only way to apply). Within a day I received a phone call from the Phone Center. They conducted a phone interview and was told if I met their requirements I would be asked back for a group interview. They asked about how I found out about the center, what would I expect if I worked there, and what I could offer as a student fundraiser. Also they made sure to ask if I was okay with asking someone for money four times in the same phone call. Of course, I told them I was since thats essentially the job. They asked me back for a group interview, which was not what I expected. I had imagined a bunch of us sitting in a round table being asked different sorts of questions. Instead, there were only 4 of us in my interview and we were asked to introduce ourselves and to tell a little about ourselves. 
After we all got to know each other, the interviewer (the manager) had us pick out a random object from a box which we would have to sell. I got a coffee mug. The box was filled with very bland items probably just collected from around the office (Can of Lysol, mug, thermal, and stamp). Next, we were given out cards which held a reason we might be given from someone we call as to why they cannot make a donation. We had to come up with a rebuttal as to what we would tell the person on the other end of the call. They were anything from "I just bought a house" to "My finances do not allow me to." Essentially, the group interview consisted of tasks that tested our ability to sell and be persistent. In addition to the group interview, we needed to fill out a survey that asked more questions. The responses to these questions and the responses at the group interview would be considered for a follow up personal interview. 
I got called back for the personal interview and was quite surprised. At the one-on-one interview with the same manager from the first interview, I got asked the typical questions "Tell me more about yourself" "what kind of activities or clubs are you part of on campus?" "Why are you the best candidate for the position?" I responded very well to all of these and thought they were quite simple. The hardest part of the interview came when the manager asked me to conduct a mock phone call and handed me a script. I read the script and said everything with confidence, until I got to the part where I ask for a $250 donation. His response was "I just graduated from Grad school and have student loans to pay." It took me longer than it should have to come up with a proper response but when I did, all the manager said was, "Thank you, thats all" and he continued onto the policies at the workplace. Its been two days since my interview and do not think I will get an offer, but he did mention that we are sent an email even if we do not get it. So thats some good news.
Interview Questions: As a nursing student, how do you expect to fit in a part time job along with a course load?

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by 7+ faculty members. All expenses (travel, food, hotel) were reimbursed. Job expectations were provided ahead of the interview as well as the handbook I would work from. I was able to ask questions and felt like a part of a team from the start.
Interview Questions: I had to "justify" why I would be qualified to supervise student teachers in subject areas other than my own.

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: I found out about the opportunity through a friend of a friend. I’ve noticed it’s very difficult to get a job at Florida State University without knowing someone. This friend was able to recommend me and that’s what got me the interview. I interviewed with several people for a one day interview. Went over requirements of position and what I wanted to do long term. Many people do not stay in this role very long, maybe 1-2 years. Interviewed with several people. Went over requirements of position and where I'd want to
Interview Questions: They asked me what book I was reading.

title: Systems Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: Met with the managers at the Center for Professional Development.  Talked and was hired on the spot.
Interview Questions: None.  If you know your technology you will not be blindsided.

title: University Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Florida State University in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: Good experience for the interview process. Went through two rounds of interviews as well as a situational experience. Everyone was very friendly.
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected in the interview,

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. After a week, they sent me a confirmation email with the time, place and instructions to follow. The interview lasts 2 days. Group activities, 1-on-1 interview and lots of hands on activities. You are assigned to a group of other candidates and you are paired up with them until the end. You have an RA leading the group, who also helps making decisions. Just be yourself.
Interview Questions: Tell me of a time when you had to go out of your comfort zone?

title: Supervisor Leadership Program Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: Behavioral Based questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time....

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Apr 2008
Interview Descriptions: I applied when the application was still on paper (it is now strictly online). I was emailed about a job offer and I accepted. I went through training and began my receptionist career with New Student Orientation. I am going into my third year of employment.
Interview Questions: Which halls are you interested in working in?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed on the phone and then met the boss in person. Overall it was a positive experience.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose FSU?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Florida State University (Tallahassee, FL) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Any previous projects and good GPA will help.
Interview Questions: Lab expertise.
